page.title: 14INDUSTRY IN SKELMERSDALE
page.content: When Skelmersdale New Town was planned in the early 1960s,several areas were designated as industrial estates.These were mainly to be situated on the fringe of the town so as to be convenient for the major motorway network and close to employees' homes.Three such areas are included in our Domesday block.These are Gillibrands,Westgate and Stanley estates. Gillibrands is by far the biggest.At the present time approximately 50 companies of varying size occupy premises there.These include a tin can manufacturing firm,clothing factories,metal fabrication works and some food industries.As well as manufacturers there are printers, packagers and youth training centres.
